meanings.definition: A type of medieval helmet with a rounded or pointed top.
meanings.sent1: The knight wore a shiny bascinet during the jousting tournament.
meanings.sent2: In the museum, you can see various bascinets displayed from different time periods.
meanings.sent3: The bascinet looked like a metal bowl perched on the knight's head.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were protected by a bascinet of determination.
meanings.sent5: The bascinet gleamed under the sunlight, reflecting the history of battles fought.

meanings.definition: To equip or protect with a bascinet.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith would bascinet the knight before the upcoming battle.
meanings.sent2: She decided to bascinet herself with knowledge before the exam.
meanings.sent3: The chef bascineted the cake with a thick layer of frosting.
meanings.sent4: He bascineted his heart with love, ready to face any challenge.
meanings.sent5: The gardener bascineted the delicate flowers with a protective cover during the storm.
